reviews.text:
Hands down, best indian cuisine in the bronx!

We‚Äôve tried a variety of items on the menu and they were all 10/10.
water
Great place! Love the garlic naan!
Little shop at the end of a long hallway. Cheap and delicious. 5 stool seats along a small counter
The Mango Lassi Drink is a one of one! As a personal trainer fitness enthusiast I would recommend for even before or after a workout üòÖ
Great food! Better service
Great food come stop by asap
Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The food is delicious, you won‚Äôt be disappointed. üòò
The food is really good and felts super authentic. The worker named Md is super nice and provides good service.
The best food in 3rd Ave very clean and workers are helpful and it‚Äôs very quick !!!! Good price
It was good.
Wonderful gentleman serving authenticate Indian food. The food was delicious. Your taste buds will be transported to India üáÆüá≥‚Ä¶
I love the natural  environment and the greeting is phenomenal  they offer the best food and Service

This place is definitely underrated, I was passing and couldn't help smelling good and comforting food and it was coming from this place!! It's clean inside the customer service was on point when ordering and answering any questions about the food. Everything was delicious my family and I will be going back and suggesting to others. Also shout outs to M.D he was welcoming and helpful in taking my order.  ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
Good
Always good food every time I order.
It was very nice and a good experience with the food
The manager is good in service and food is delicious. Thanks shaown
Bro at the counter was wild helpful. Would recommend
Great food
Food is very delicious and fair prices
Staff was friendly and co operative.
Wholesome spot, authentic Indian cuisine! Hidden gem you must try!

I have been to this restaurant four times
The first time for Mango Lassi, it was thick with lots of yogurt , The second time I ordered Goat Curry - in my country, Trinidad , it is not made with tomatoes but this one was. I was surprised .. I wish I could've had more meat. It was spicy but not too spicy. It was good. The third time, I ordered rice pudding for a friend, I did not get to taste it but today I am having chicken samosas. Very good. I always hold on to their menu at home because I know I'll be back
Good food, good service!
Great place will be back
Food well prepared.Very fresh and delicious
Food is very fresh. You can small the food before walking in.
Everything I‚Äôve tried has been amazing and the samosas are perfectly cooked!
Food very good and smell amazing the moment u walk in. Good service too. Worth the wait.

Best indian spot in the bronx!
You wont be disappointed!
food is very good
Good food with specially  shaown guid me a lot. Thanks I will come again
Great stuff and customer service.
Very respectable and adequate with services
This was was small but great exactly my type of place to get great food i loved this experience treated me nice great food and service was beautiful i definitely recommend
me and my mom always come here every now and then to eat, i love how the food is always good whenever we get it, very refreshing!
Food was fire great service

Very good customer service
Would try again!!!
Very good customer service
The man at the front was patient , helpful , and took my order after hours .
Simosas were delicious. I will try more food next time.
Very good food tasty
Great food at an affordable price! A go to lunch spot
The food is Good! I personally could use more Flavors! Not Spice But Flavors some items lack Flavors but I will be going back again!
Best butter chicken in NY.
Very good , should definitely try out! Got myself the chicken over rice and a garlic naan
So clean, bonus points its halalü§ó
10/10 would here again

When I ate their chicken tikka Marsala I was hit with a bomb of flavor. Their food is packed with a ton of flavor. I had mine with garlic naan bread but I was confused because when I got home I saw there was no rice but I paid extra for naan. So you get a choice of either naan or rice and if you want naan you pay extra but no rice. It was delicious and I would recommend üíØ it is a small joint but they know how to cook. The atmosphere, I wish they had a/c but it wasn't hot or crazy.

Edit: I had their butter chicken but it wasn't as good as their Tikka masala, the butter chicken is more tangy and it tasted like it has lemon or a bit sour. The chicken didn't look like it was fresh or that it was cooked in the sauce. It didn't seem part of the sauce like the Tikka masala I had days ago. I'm staying away from it. My next dish is their biryani either chicken or shrimp. I'll keep you guys posted.

Best chicken over rice I had in nyc!!! Perfectly marinated grilled chicken with the combination of red pepper, green pepper and onion. They‚Äôre so generous with the white sauce too. Everything compliments each other and presents a mouth watering platter. Definitely try it yourself

This restaurants food offerings dont match its small and out of the way appearance. I ordered the chicken over rice and the mango lassi, and they were both incredible! The chicken over rice was flavorful, filling, and well seasoned. The mango lassi has an understated but addicting taste. I definitely recommend this restaurant if you're in the area.

This is the second time I come here and although it is a small spot, consider it a hidden gem! Great service! Good portions and the taste is amazing! Food is cooked per order and tastes fresh! Definitely recommend!
Service quick and respectful. I had the chicken over rice, it looked good but it tasted even better! Everything is halal and you can pay with apple play which is convenient üòÅ

Delicious halal food with vegan and vegetarian options. A great find located at 3rd Ave near 149th St inside a small entrance.

Also recommend the vegetable Samosas which is a popular pastry filled with masala peas and potatoes üòã

I originally had put a 5 star rating, but that was based off of what we had when they first opened. Since opening the quality of the food has gone way down. If you want to clean out your intestines, then this is the place to go. Butter chicken is lime a staple, however theirs is so watery, not thick and creamy at all. Please make an effort to step your game up, especially for the prices you are charging!

Mamar Bari in New York offers a fantastic dining experience, with their Chicken Korma and Butter Chicken standing out as highlights. The Chicken Korma is rich, creamy, and perfectly spiced, while the Butter Chicken is indulgently smooth with a slightly smoky flavor. Both dishes are expertly prepared, showcasing authentic flavors that will satisfy any curry lover. The atmosphere is welcoming, making it a great spot for a cozy meal with friends or family. Highly recommended for those craving delicious Indian cuisine!

This hidden gem at the heart of 3rd avenue in the bronx is both underrated and criminally overlooked, despite its hidden location the service was very welcoming and wait time was not bad at all. Being my first time tasting Indian cuisine I actually enjoyed it despite my hesitation. Would recommend to any friends or family who lives in the area. (definitely try the samosas)

This is my first time trying the wings here and all imma say these are the best wings I ever had. This is a must try spot very authentic Indian cuisine and if you‚Äôre looking for a hole in the wall, this is where you can find it.

I‚Äôve been coming here Monday-Friday for lunch and the staff at this establishment has always exceeded my expectations. Ordering is easy no hassle, I‚Äôm always called my food is ready at great prices that I can afford. The staff always greets me with a smile, I always get the goat curry with garlic nan and it‚Äôs always a 5 star. GOAT is well seasoned and tender and Nan is soft and warm.

‚∏ª

I recently visited this restaurant and was blown away by both the food and the service! The gulab jamun was absolutely divine‚Äîsoft, perfectly soaked in syrup, and bursting with rich, authentic flavor. It had just the right amount of sweetness and melted in my mouth with every bite.

The service was equally impressive. The staff was warm, attentive, and made sure we felt welcome from the moment we walked in. Our orders were served promptly, and they checked in often to ensure we had everything we needed.

Great service, no wait time. They charge $1 tax on cash purchase. $11.99 menu item is $13. No parking at this location and finding it was a bit difficult, but food was prepared quickly and order was taken quickly. The dining area is limited to a small area, but it‚Äôs nice that they have one. I would give this place 5 stars if the place was cleaner and more inviting. It‚Äôs really great otherwise

My first time ever trying butter chicken and Indian food in general, the place is very well organized and the people working there seem very professional and kind. This is by far one of the best foods I ever have tasted its rich, creamy, savory has the perfect amount of spice, when you dip the rice in the butter chicken it just makes for a excellent combo everything about this is a 10/10!

I will definitely be buying from here more often and even recommending this to my family!

The people are friendly, the atmosphere feels nice n private, and it smells great! If you get something with shrimp, the tails are still on it. You will have to get your hands dirty to take off the tails-which is weird that places do that. The mild flavor is truly mild. Flavorful, not hot. I like this place!

this opened up near where I live and I have to say it‚Äôs a really nice spot. Service is great, quick food prep and the food  is really good. This restaurant is a real highlight living in the South Bronx where we  surrounded by lots of fast food spots. So if you‚Äôre looking for something different to eat -you definitely wanna come here
I‚Äôll definitely come back a 10/10 definitely recommend the garlic Naan and chicken tikka masala and chicken over rice and the chicken gyroüò©ü©µ.

Just went here and the food was absolutely incredible! Fahad and the people at the restaurant offer excellent customer service and have very reasonable prices! Please, next time you visit NYC you better head straight to this place because it is a hidden gem!

I was walking to chipotle and I saw this spot and changed my mind and it was the right decision. Tried a spinach cheese dish that was really good and a little spicy and the guy suggested a yogurt mango drink that was refreshing and quite good. Always cool to find an authentic hole in the wall spot in the Bronx.

I spent $35 and got Simosas as an appetizer, Lamb Saagwala, Garlic Naan and a rice pudding for dessert. It was enough for 2 days! Seating area is limited but this food you want to take to the comfort of your home. That rice pudding, i added cinnamon, oh my delish!
Owners are friendly, conversational, and make want to return. It‚Äôs refreshing to see different cultural restaurant in the South Bronx that‚Äôs affordable, healthier and freaking delicious! Welcome to our neighborhood ‚ù§Ô∏è

I came here today food was amazing. Definitely made with love. I will definitely be coming back. I had the butter chicken which was done to my spice level perfectly ( I ordered mild) and it came with basmati rice. I also ordered Chicken Samosas. They were not dry at all. The chicken was well seasoned Definitely worth it. The garlic Naan was done very well not burnt and it tasted great! 5 stars!

This is delicious food!   Freshly made and very flavorful.  Saagwala was spot on.  Masala was a little oily, but absolutely delicious.  Naan was unlike others we have had.  It was not fluffy and dry, it was more flat and dense.  Good service.  Good prices.  Authentic atmosphere.  This place is designed for take out.  About 6 bar-style stools inside is the only seating.  We would definitely order from Mamar Bari again!

Restaurant is Clean, friendly customer service. You first thing you will notice is the amazing aroma of spices that just makes you more eager to try everything on the menu. I‚Äôm a butter chicken fiend so I can‚Äôt wait to try. Thank you for the food.

My server was so nice ! Found a hidden gem on my way home and I was so excited to see this restaurant in third ave ! The aroma of spices walking in had me excited lol definitely a go to now food was absolutely delicious üòÄ

I walked in and was properly greeted , with a warm welcome . Offered recommendations, and help if needed . The food was amazing the garlic naan was moist and flavorful . The butter chicken had the perfect amount of spice . I would recommend everyone I know

I am a Latino from the Bronx with an Indian wife.

I've tasted biryani several times but never liked it...until now.

The shrimp biryani is DELICIOUS!!!

Definitely coming back.

I ordered catering for a community meeting in Mott Haven, and EVERYONE loved the food (tiki masala, Chana saagwala, jasmine rice, vegetable samosas and garlic naan) and couldn‚Äôt stop raving about it. The food arrived on time, and the owners were very professional and kind. Great value for the quality (which was solid). We look forward to ordering from there again. üôåüèΩüîù

I recently had the pleasure of eating from this restaurant. The food was absolutely amazing. It tasted home-made and left me wanting more. The service and hospitality was also wonderful. I will definitely be returning.
Amazingly delicious food! Super kind people and excellent service. The actual place is hard to find and doesn't have indoor seating, but the taste of the food makes it more than worth it!
Hands down the best Indian food in the Bronx! The service was outstanding, and every dish was incredibly fresh. Truly a hidden gem.
They charged for rice and chicken $18. It wasn‚Äôt tasty, and it was spicy and no vegetables. Very boring food for its price
Ordered catering from here for an event and it was a hit! Everyone loved the food and the restaurant was super communicative and great to work with. They delivered everything right on time.

This is my first review ever, that alone should tell you how good the food is. I found out about this place through ‚Äúsavor the Bronx‚Äù campaign and didn‚Äôt expect much. It‚Äôs a hole in the wall spot that shares its space with multiple different businesses and doesn‚Äôt have a strong online presence but this place is such a hidden gem. If you like Indian food you‚Äôll love this place everything is made in-house from scratch and you can taste the difference. Family owned business with passionate staff. Best Indian food I‚Äôve had in the Bronx hands down.
So grateful for a place like this in our neighborhood. They make the food fresh when you order it. Nothing frozen. Very authentic
If you want good real authentic brown people food come to this place! Just try out the wings, very sweet very fresh. I‚Äôm brown so it doesn‚Äôt feel spicy to me. But definitely come by!
One of the best indian food very fresh and tasted good.
Tried the samosa, biryani, wings,  garlic naan and lamb masala. Everything was flavorless dry and super over priced except the masala. That's the only decent thing.
